intro: Achetaria, commonly known as the false lily of the valley, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Primulaceae. It consists of several species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are typically herbaceous perennials with showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. They have linear to lance-shaped leaves and often grow in moist, shaded environments. Achetaria species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens.
